definition[0]: an association whose aim is to encourage the economic growth, social progress, and cultural development of Southeast Asia. Its members are Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore, Vietnam, Brunei, Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, and the Philippines.
definition[1]: Association of South East Asian Nations; a political and economic group of countries formed in 1967 which now has 10 members including Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam
